author: @WSMV
title: TSU receives federal grant to help study gentrification, affordable housing in Nashville
text:
TSU receives federal grant to help study gentrification, affordable housing in Nashville
TSU will study the “impact of displacement and relocation from gentrifying neighborhoods in the Greater Nashville Region.”
NASHVILLE, Tenn. (WSMV) - A $1 million grant given to Tennessee State University by the U.S Department of Housing and Urban Development is looking to help solve the housing crisis in Nashville. Its goal is to provide solutions to mass gentrification and displacement.
Dera Dowell has lived in her North Nashville house for 53 years. Generations of her family have called it home, and she says that’s not changing any time soon, despite constant calls from developers.
“I tell them there’s plenty of houses they have built, so buy one of them because I’m not selling,” Dowell said.
She’s keeping her house, but not everyone can afford to. Many in the area are forced out because of rising prices and new expensive builds.
“Rent is too high. We need something that we can afford because we have families,” Dowell said.
The grant given to TSU researchers will help them to study areas including North Nashville where you can find expensive houses built this year next to homes that have been there for decades.
“What we are trying to do is to provide evidence-based solutions that can help the communities be empowered as well as inform more sustainable and urban policy developments,” Dr. Rafael Harun said, “We are trying to map displacement due to gentrification and then trying to find out how effective government policies are, for example, the voucher program”
Harun is one of the TSU professors leading the team of researchers.
“We are seeing a huge price hike, housing becoming unaffordable. So if you’re making less than $50,000, most likely you will not find any feasible location or affordable location to live,” Harun said.
He says the goal is to have a real impact on the future of Nashville. Mayor Freddie O’Connell’s office has said by 2025 the affordable housing shortage will rise to 31,000 units.
“We evaluate that whether people have access to affordable housing units or not. If they have them, that’s great. If not, we will be generating some policy solutions that can be implemented to ensure that there are policies in place,” Harun said.
Dowell says she hopes studies like this will help create solutions so that families can keep their homes.
“The area is great, so I can understand why people want to move in, but we just can’t afford these houses that they are building in the area,” Dowell said.
Copyright 2024 WSMV. All rights reserved.

author: @andaluciainf
title: Muere un anciano y una mujer resulta herida grave en un accidente de coche en Níjar | Andalucía Información. Todas las noticias de Sociedad
text: Un hombre ha muerto y una mujer ha resultado herida de carácter grave a causa de un accidente de tráfico registrado esta tarde en la carretera AL-3106 en Níjar (Almería), según informa el servicio unificado de emergencias 112 de Andalucía. El siniestro se produjo sobre las 17.45 horas en la carretera AL-3106, en el municipio de Níjar. Ambos ancianos viajaban en el mismo turismo que se salió de la vía cuando circulaban por la carretera que va desde Las Hortichuelas a las Negras. Tras el aviso a 112 y la activación de los operativos, hasta el lugar se desplazaron servicios sanitarios, Guardia Civil de Tráfico, Protección Civil de Níjar y Mantenimiento de la Vía. El hombre, de unos ochenta años de edad, ha fallecido en el lugar del accidente mientras que a la mujer, también de edad avanzada, consiguieron estabilizarla y trasladarla con vida al Hospital Torrecárdenas. Se ha activado el protocolo judicial. Envía tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)

author: VICTOR ANDREWS | Staff writer
title: Ready for the weekend? Here are New Orleans events for Jan. 24-26
text:
After several days locked in the ice and sneaux (enough, Elsa!), New Orleans area folks are looking for some fun things to do before Carnival and Super Bowl usher in a new vortex of excitement. Stay warm. Stay tuned and stay active.
LPO and OperaCréole team up to present the world premiere of a groundbreaking opera Friday at St. Louis Cathedral. "MORGIANE" is the 1887 work by New Orleans native Edmond Dédé and is the earliest known full-length opera by a Black American composer. The performance is part of the Historic New Orleans Collection's Musical Louisiana program that includes a lecture at 5 p.m. at the Williams Research Center, 410 Chartres St., and the free performance at 7:30 p.m. Check out more information here.
The KREWE MOSAÏQUE takes its sophomore stroll through the French Quarter Saturday at 6 p.m. starting at St. Ann and Rampart streets, then heads down to Bourbon Street and turns left, takes a right at St. Philip Street for a block, takes a right onto Royal Street, a left onto St. Ann and another left on Chartres Street and ending at St. Philip. Look for subkrewes like Krewe de Mayahuel, Mondo Kaya, Krewe of Conus, the Weather Girls, Krewe of Heavenly Bodies, Krewe of Nyades and more. Scroll over here for more information.
It's a great day for Great Books, Saturday, that is, when the LPO Symphony Volunteers are at it again — this time in a POP UP BOOK SALE from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. at the group's new warehouse, 623 Distributors Row, Suite F, in Elmwood. In addition to a selection of fiction, history, religion and cookbooks, the volunteers will be selling artwork. It's a great way to break through the icy days of isolation and get some good reading material. Read all about it right here.
LOVE YOUR CITY AWARDS GALA celebrates local organizations for helping make the Crescent City have a sustainable future. Winners in 10 categories will be honored Friday at 7 p.m. at the New Orleans Jazz Market at 1436 Oretha Castle Haley Blvd. Big Chief Shaka Zulu will be the speaker, with performances by Saint Amethyst, Trumpeter Andres "Da Phessah" Baham and more. There's also an art auction by Young Artist Movement. Tickets start at $82. Check the festivities here.
Raise a glass when the Crescent City Homebrewers gather for WINTERFEST 2025, a celebration of the craft from 4 p.m. to 8 p.m. Saturday at Deutsches Haus, 1700 Moss St., New Orleans. More than 40 home-brewed beverages will be available at the "all-you-can-drink" event, plus live music. The $40 ticket also includes membership in the group. Raise a pint here.
The NOLA Project salutes Scottish author Robert "Rabbie" Burns with BURNS NIGHT, an evening of poetry, play reading and partying at 6 p.m. Saturday at Jacob Schoen & Son, 3827 Canal St. The local acting party celebrates the Caledonian wordsmith's birthday with food, beverages and an ensemble of players reading Gilliam Duffy's "The Ghosting of Rabbie Burns." Reservations are requested for the free event (a $20 donation is suggested). Take a wee gander here for more information, laddie.
After all this "sneaux-maggedon," everyone needs a good laugh and Saturday at 7 p.m., "HOPPED UP STAND-UP" brings the funny to the front at Urban South Brewery, 1645 Tchoupitoulas St. Hosted by Ryan Rogers, the funny folks frolicking on stage will include Brandon Haynes, J.Q. Palms, Pickle, Madison Thomas and Josh Watts. Admission is free. Snag a seat for the side-splitting sounds here.
It's ball season but this isn't that kind of a deb ball, it's the 610 STOMPERS DEBUTANTE BALL. At 8 p.m. Saturday, see the 2025 dance moves at the annual fête at The Fillmore, on the second floor of Caesars casino at the foot of Canal Street. The theme is "610 Movie Night: Be Kind, Rewind," and movie attire from the '80s and '90s is encouraged. Enjoy music by Johnny Sketch and the Dirty Notes, a costume contest and late-night pizza. Tickets start at $75. So get into that crop top and jeans or minisuit and thigh-high stockings and head out for the fun.
Head down to the Bywater and get in on the fun Sunday from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. for Bywater Bakery's KING CAKE CELEBRATION. The 9th annual festivity features a huge slice of local talent, including Soul Brass Band, Deacon John and John Boutté. And half of the proceeds from the king cake sales will go to the Ellis Marsalis Center for Music. Make your way over to 3624 Dauphine St. and bite into the fun. Take a taste here.

author: نايف زيداني ــ حيفا,
title: أبرز مضامين رد الاحتلال على مقترح ويتكوف المعدل.. لا تعهد بوقف الحرب
text:
استمع إلى الملخص
- ترفض إسرائيل التعهد بإنهاء الحرب قبل اتفاق مسبق، رغم الضغوط الدولية، وتنتظر رد حماس التي أبدت إشارة إيجابية تجاه الصيغة الجديدة لاتفاق وقف إطلاق النار.
- يعود التقدم في المحادثات إلى الضغط القطري على حماس، مع ضمانات أوضح لإنهاء الحرب، لكن لا يتوقع حدوث انفراجة هذا الأسبوع.
القناة 12: الرد يتضمن تشدداً بشأن توزيع المساعدات وإنهاء الحرب
المرحلة الأولى تتضمن من المقترح إطلاق سراح نصف المحتجزين في غزة
ترقب إسرائيلي لرد "حماس" قبل إرسال وفد التفاوض للدوحة أو القاهرة
قدّمت دولة الاحتلال الإسرائيلي، أمس الأربعاء، ردها على مقترح ويتكوف المعدل للتوصل إلى صفقة مع حركة حماس، وذلك بعد حديث رئيس الوزراء بنيامين نتنياهو قبل يومين عن وجود تقدّم في المفاوضات، لكنها رفضت التعهد بإنهاء الحرب على قطاع غزة. وأفادت القناة 12 العبرية عبر موقعها الإلكتروني اليوم الخميس، أنه بعد المناقشات التي جرت بمشاركة نتنياهو وكبار المسؤولين في المؤسسة الأمنية، ووزير الأمن يسرائيل كاتس، والوزير رون ديرمر، المسؤول عن ملف المفاوضات، قامت إسرائيل أمس، بصياغة وتقديم رد رسمي على المقترح الذي كُشف عنه في الأيام الأخيرة، ونُقل عبر قطر، مشيرة إلى الاتفاق على التعديلات التي يشملها الرد بالإجماع في إسرائيل، قبل أن جرى إرسالها عبر الوسطاء إلى حماس.
ويتضمن الرد الإسرائيلي، وفقاً للقناة ذاتها، مرونة في بعض الجوانب، ولكنه يشمل أيضاً نقاطاً تتشدد فيها إسرائيل، خاصة في ما يتعلق بدفعات إطلاق سراح المحتجزين، وإنهاء الحرب، وتوزيع المساعدات الإنسانية. وتبدي دولة الاحتلال انفتاحاً على مناقشة مراحل إطلاق سراح عشرة محتجزين إسرائيليين من قطاع غزة، والتعهد بعدم انتهاك وقف إطلاق النار طوال مدته. وفي المقابل، ترفض إسرائيل تقديم أي "تنازلات" في ما يتعلق بإنهاء الحرب. ولفتت القناة العبرية، إلى أنه على الرغم من مطالبة الرئيس الأميركي دونالد ترامب
ومن بين المسائل الأخرى التي تخضع لنقاش مكثّف، مسألة توزيع المساعدات الإنسانية في غزة. وتشعر إسرائيل بالرضا عن كون المساعدات لم تعد تحت سيطرة حماس، وترى أن إعادة الوضع إلى سابق عهده سيعيد تعزيز قوة حماس على المستوى المدني ومستوى السلطة، ولذلك هي غير مستعدة للعودة إلى الوراء. وبحسب ما ذكرته القناة العبرية، سيكون هناك خلاف جوهري بين الجانبين حول هذه المسألة.
وتدّعي القناة العبرية، أن مختلف الأطراف تنتظر رد حماس في هذه المرحلة، وإذا ما كان "معقولاً وبنّاءً"، فسيكون بالإمكان مناقشة إرسال وفود إلى الدوحة أو القاهرة لمواصلة المحادثات حول التفاصيل. وكان نتنياهو، قد نشر أول من أمس الثلاثاء، مقطع فيديو على حسابه في تطبيق تليغرام، أشار فيه إلى تحقيق تقدّم كبير في المحادثات مع حركة حماس بشأن صفقة الأسرى، لكنّه أكد أنّه "من السابق لأوانه زرع الآمال"، ورفع سقف التوقعات. وقبل ذلك، أفادت القناة 12 العبرية، بتلقّي إسرائيل إشارة إيجابية من حركة حماس، حول درجة معينة من الانفتاح تجاه الصيغة الجديدة لاتفاق وقف إطلاق النار في غزة، التي تجري مناقشتها حالياً في العاصمة القطرية الدوحة.
وذكرت القناة ذاتها يوم الأحد، أنّ الوسيط الفلسطيني-الأميركي بشارة بحبح صاغ تعديلاً على اقتراح المبعوث الأميركي إلى الشرق الأوسط ستيف ويتكوف في محاولة لجلب حركة حماس إلى طاولة المفاوضات. وتابعت أنه في الاقتراح الجديد، الذي يُعتبر نسخة معدّلة من مقترح ويتكوف هناك ضمانات أوضح، وإن لم تكن مطلقة، لإنهاء الحرب على غزة. وتشمل المرحلة الأولى، إطلاق سراح نصف المحتجزين، سواء الأحياء أو الأموات.
ونقلت القناة نفسها، مساء الاثنين، عن مصدرين؛ أحدهما إسرائيلي والآخر أجنبي، لم تسمّهما، أنّ هناك إشارة أولية، وحتى درجة معينة من الانفتاح من حركة حماس تجاه الاقتراح الجديد، ما قد يؤدي إلى تفاهمات. ومع ذلك، جرى التعبير عن هذه التصريحات بحذر شديد. ووفقاً للقناة، فإن التقدّم في المحادثات مع حماس، يعود في جزء منه إلى الضغط القطري الذي يُمارس على قيادة حماس في الخارج، بالإضافة إلى تطوّر معين في القضية الأكثر تعقيداً، وهي الالتزام بإنهاء الحرب. وتبدو الصيغة الجديدة، بحسب القناة العبرية، وكأنها قد تُستقبل بروح أكثر إيجابية، خاصّة إذا جرى إرفاقها أيضاً بتصريح أميركي، بوصفه ضماناً شفهياً غير مكتوب، يفيد بأنّ واشنطن ستفعل كل ما في وسعها لإنهاء الحرب.
ويوم الثلاثاء، قال موقع أكسيوس الأميركي عبر منصة إكس، نقلاً عن مسؤولَين كبيرَين أميركي وإسرائيلي، إنه لا يتوقع حدوث انفراجة في محادثات مرتقبة هذا الأسبوع حول وقف إطلاق النار في غزة، لكنّ الجهود المبذولة لإقناع حماس بتخفيف موقفها حيال مقترح تدعمه الولايات المتحدة تحرز تقدماً. ويعود ذلك جزئياً إلى تزايد ضغط الوسطاء القطريين، بحسب المسؤولين. وقال المسؤول الأميركي: "لا نتوقع تحقيق تقدّم هذا الأسبوع، لكنّ هناك تقدماً بالتأكيد، ونحن أقرب مما كنّا نعتقد للتوصل إلى اتفاق".

author: Karina H. Barrera
title: César Bono ya no puede mover la mitad de su cuerpo, pero ni así piensa dejar de trabajar
text:
César Bono, de 74 años de edad, confesó que ya no puede mover la mitad de su cuerpo, pero ni así piensa dejar de trabajar.
El querido actor mexicano César Bono, de 74 años de edad, ha enfrentado desafíos de salud significativos en los últimos años.
En 2018, César Bono sufrió ocho infartos cerebrales en una sola noche, lo que dejó secuelas permanentes en su movilidad.
A 7 años de distancia, César Bono reveló que enfrenta dolores constantes que afectan la mitad de su cuerpo.
César Bono revela que nunca más podrá mover la mano izquierda
La situación de César Bono es tan seria que, en entrevista para el diario El Universal, confesó que no recuperará la movilidad de su mano izquierda.
César Bono señaló que toma terapias físicas y tratamientos médicos, pero los especialistas le han dicho que ni así recuperará la movilidad de su mano izquierda.
Intentando restarle seriedad al asunto, César Bono bromeó diciendo que su mano izquierda se murió antes que él, lo que a pesar de todo, calificó como positivo.
César Bono vive con constante dolor pero aún así no piensa retirarse de la actuación hasta que su cuerpo se lo permita
El comediante detalló que los dolores físicos son una constante en su vida diaria, especialmente durante las noches, que es cuando se intensifican.
Aún así, César Bono dijo que intenta llevar una vida lo más normal que le es posible, trabajando todos los días a pesar del dolor.
Esto, según dijo, es molesto durante el día, pero lo verdaderamente desgastante son las noches, cuando sus dolores se intensifican.
A pesar de estas adversidades, César Bono mantiene una actitud resiliente y continúa con su rutina laboral.
Actualmente, el actor sigue participando en la serie ‘Vecinos, demostrando su compromiso y pasión por la actuación.
Su determinación es evidente, ya que, a pesar de las limitaciones físicas, reiteró a El Universal que no contempla retirarse de los escenarios.
¿Qué pasará cuando sus dolencias ya no le permitan ser independiente? César Bono dijo que ha considerado la posibilidad de mudarse a la Casa del Actor para no ser una carga para su familia.

author: Cristian Agatie
title: Seasoned Tesla Owner Who Switched to a Rivian R1S Shares His Honest Opinion About the SUV - autoevolution
text: Tesla owners are very loyal customers who rarely switch to other carmakers. In my experience, people who tried other EVs were disappointed, and some even changed back to a Tesla afterward. However, a recent story shows that sometimes, switching to a Rivian R1S can be the right thing to do, even for a die-hard Tesla fan. Whenever somebody considers buying an electric vehicle, Tesla pops up as the go-to choice. Elon Musk's company has many incentives for potential buyers, including the most extensive and best charging network in the world. Tesla is also appreciated for its software and timely over-the-air updates and is usually a step ahead of the competition technology-wise. However, not everyone wants a Tesla; otherwise, nobody else would be selling EVs. Sometimes, even Tesla owners are tempted to try a different brand. Rivian is one of the carmakers that has been considered the next best thing to Tesla in many ways. Rivian only offers two models for now, the R1T pickup truck and the R1S SUV, sharing many characteristics and parts. It has also been praised for its Rivian has targeted its electric vehicles to the adventure-loving crowd, with characteristics that make them perfect for off-road trips. Until the Cybertruck was launched, Tesla did not have an equivalent offering. This made the transition from a Tesla to a Rivian awkward sometimes. I've written in the past about such experiences and, most of the time, they didn't end up with a The most prominent case was that of YouTuber and former baseball player Ryan Pineda, who sold his Model X to buy a Rivian R1S in December 2022. Pineda was a Tesla fan until he saw the Rivian R1S, but then he wanted the adventure SUV more than anything else. He was so thrilled about the R1S that he made a video to show all the cool stuff the Rivian had while bashing Tesla in the process. The love affair lasted only one month, after which Pineda Now, I once again stumbled upon a story of a Tesla owner who decided to give Rivian a try. He goes by the handle u/hashjoin on Reddit, but I'll call him John from now on. John is a six-year Tesla owner, having a 2023 Model X and a 2022 Model Y. He also has two toddlers, and they're often four adults, so a six-seater was a must. Although he wasn't the adventurous kind, John was seduced by the Rivian R1S. He loved the design, the build quality, and the vast space inside the SUV, especially compared to the Model X. The Rivian is also fun to drive, and, having the Performance Dual Motor variant with a Max Pack, he also enjoyed the 400-mile range. Another thing that John loved was that Rivian kept the simple things as they should, even if they might be considered "boring" by some. These include the signal and drive selector stalks, ultrasonic sensors, blind spot detector radars, and autowipers that actually work. Having a Wi-Fi hotspot and a 110-volt outlet is also incredibly convenient for those who need work on a road trip. Of course, John also notes a few things that were not as he expected, starting with the lack of a glove compartment. However, the wireless charging pad is the most annoying, as many Rivian owners found out. It's almost impossible to align an iPhone to charge wirelessly, so he gave up and Between things that are better and those that are not, there are also some things that can be improved by a software update. For instance, John found it difficult to add a new driver to the vehicle, as it required registering an account with Rivian. In a Tesla, you can do this from the car, which is much easier, especially for the less tech-savvy members of the family. Other annoying things were the navigation system and the Rivian is one of the carmakers that has been considered the next best thing to Tesla in many ways. Rivian only offers two models for now, the R1T pickup truck and the R1S SUV, sharing many characteristics and parts. It has also been praised for its [promising software](https://www.autoevolution.com/news/rivian-overhauls-user-interface-adds-new-features-with-upcoming-halloween-software-update-222272.html), although its Driver+ assistance system can't hold a candle to Tesla's Autopilot, let alone Full Self-Driving. But that didn't stop many Tesla owners from trying to see what was with all the hype around Rivian. Rivian has targeted its electric vehicles to the adventure-loving crowd, with characteristics that make them perfect for off-road trips. Until the Cybertruck was launched, Tesla did not have an equivalent offering. This made the transition from a Tesla to a Rivian awkward sometimes. I've written in the past about such experiences and, most of the time, they didn't end up with a [happy customer.](https://www.autoevolution.com/news/rivian-owner-coming-from-a-tesla-gives-his-honest-opinion-about-which-is-better-209239.html) In one case, the new owner admitted that the Rivian R1T he bought was inferior to the Tesla in many aspects, but being a truck guy, he was willing to compromise. In two other cases, though, the defectors regretted the decision so much that they did their best to switch back to a Tesla. In one case, this meant selling the Rivian and buying back the [old Tesla Model X](https://www.autoevolution.com/news/tesla-model-x-owner-sold-the-suv-and-bought-a-rivian-r1t-instead-instantly-regretting-it-210386.html)at a premium. That's how much they liked the Rivian. The most prominent case was that of YouTuber and former baseball player Ryan Pineda, who sold his Model X to buy a Rivian R1S in December 2022. Pineda was a Tesla fan until he saw the Rivian R1S, but then he wanted the adventure SUV more than anything else. He was so thrilled about the R1S that he made a video to show all the cool stuff the Rivian had while bashing Tesla in the process. The love affair lasted only one month, after which Pineda [ditched the Rivian](https://www.autoevolution.com/news/guy-who-sold-tesla-model-x-for-a-rivian-r1s-reconsiders-his-options-takes-his-words-back-211750.html)and bought a Tesla Model Y instead. Now, I once again stumbled upon a story of a Tesla owner who decided to give Rivian a try. He goes by the handle u/hashjoin on Reddit, but I'll call him John from now on. John is a six-year Tesla owner, having a 2023 Model X and a 2022 Model Y. He also has two toddlers, and they're often four adults, so a six-seater was a must. Although he wasn't the adventurous kind, John was seduced by the Rivian R1S. He loved the design, the build quality, and the vast space inside the SUV, especially compared to the Model X. The Rivian is also fun to drive, and, having the Performance Dual Motor variant with a Max Pack, he also enjoyed the 400-mile range. Another thing that John loved was that Rivian kept the simple things as they should, even if they might be considered "boring" by some. These include the signal and drive selector stalks, ultrasonic sensors, blind spot detector radars, and autowipers that actually work. Having a Wi-Fi hotspot and a 110-volt outlet is also incredibly convenient for those who need work on a road trip. John soon discovered that Rivian's range estimates were more conservative, especially compared to the overly optimistic Teslas. This was another plus for the Rivian, as was the Driver+ assistance system. The latter was a pleasant surprise, actually, considering that he had low expectations based on other reviews shared online. In his own words, Rivian's Driver+ is "better than how Tesla Autopilot did in 2018 but not as good as Teslas today." Of course, John also notes a few things that were not as he expected, starting with the lack of a glove compartment. However, the wireless charging pad is the most annoying, as many Rivian owners found out. It's almost impossible to align an iPhone to charge wirelessly, so he gave up and [ordered an aftermarket](https://www.autoevolution.com/news/rivian-owners-chose-aftermarket-solutions-after-cost-cutting-measures-crippled-the-horn-223293.html)MagSafe charger. Between things that are better and those that are not, there are also some things that can be improved by a software update. For instance, John found it difficult to add a new driver to the vehicle, as it required registering an account with Rivian. In a Tesla, you can do this from the car, which is much easier, especially for the less tech-savvy members of the family. Other annoying things were the navigation system and the

author: Vivian Rennie
title: More 20+ ft waves will pair with high tides and rain chances into the weekend
text: Good morning Central Coast and happy Friday! If there is one thing that I hope everyone gets from this forecast is that safety is key over the next few days. High tides and extremely strong waves from an offshore pattern of storms continues to push onshore and bring life threatening conditions. There have been several water rescues already and we are far from done. Stepping down from that soap box here is what we have going on today across the Central Coast! There is a lot of energy in the Pacific basin thanks to several strong storms pushing through the North Pacific. While we will not get hit directly by this storm the waves made their impact Thursday and will continue to do so into the weekend. For Friday morning there is a little break between the most intense swell conditions but don't let that fool you, more of those 20+ ft waves will move in today. The waves will also combine with large tides, producing coastal flooding in some areas. There is a High Surf Warning and Coastal Flood Warning for the Central Coast. Waves 15-20 feet will have some max breaks to 25 feet through Saturday at 10 p.m. The Central Coast's high tides will be around 6 feet. The combination of both causes coastal flooding, among other risks. The South Coast has a Coastal Flood Advisory for similar conditions but just not as much wave action as the Central Coast. There is also a High Surf Advisory for 7-12 foot breakers with some max sets of 15-20 feet. A tidal bulge of roughly 6 feet at high tide will cause some areas of coastal flood risk. While the worst of the wave and tide combo may have already occurred, there is still warning level potential into later Saturday. Please avoid flooded areas and surfing. Waves should be avoided unless you are an experienced surfer and willing to accept the risks. Beyond the waves and tide, we still must talk about a significant system rolling into the Central Coast later Friday into Saturday. It is important to note that it will not rain much of Friday, with the activity arriving after sunset. This is a deep trough of low pressure and rain could be in the .50-1.50” range with the SLO County North Coast seeing as much as 2”. The deep interior may only see amounts to .25”. After the Friday-Saturday system, there is a system flying down the coast later Sunday PM into the very early hours Monday. While most of Sunday shouldn’t see rain this late, the "splash and dash" system looks to go through after the sun is down, so it may not be represented in icons on a forecast. After that, another small and fast-moving "splash and dash" is possible on January 3 with more fast-moving systems possible after that. Have a wonderful day and weekend Central Coast!

author: Mark Swanson
title: Trump Condemns 'Wicked System' of Christian Persecution
text: By Mark Swanson | Friday, 23 February 2024 02:18 PM EST Republican presidential front-runner Donald Trump decried persecution of Christians at the hands of the Biden administration and vowed that "no one will be touching the cross of Christ under" a second Trump administration. Trump made the comments Thursday during a speech at the National Religious Broadcasters (NRB) convention in Nashville, Tennessee. "For all Americans, but especially for Christians, nothing is more important than to defeat this wicked system and to return to equal and impartial justice under the constitutional rule of law," Trump told the crowd of more than 2,500 at the Gaylord Opryland Resort and Convention Center. "Never again will the federal government be used to target you, religious believers," Trump said, then referencing six pro-life activists who were sentenced to 11 years in prison for protesting outside of a Tennessee abortion facility in March 2021. They were found guilty of violating the Freedom of Access to Clinic Entrances Act and conspiracy against rights — "outrageous charges," Trump said. "The same DOJ that dropped charges against Antifa, where they killed people, where they destroyed cities … the same Biden DOJ has rounded up six pro-life activists right here in Tennessee, arresting them for a peaceful protest outside a clinic, where they prayed, sang hymns, and were removed with great force," Trump said. "These are persecuted Christians. They are being persecuted by Joe Biden and his people." "No one will be touching the cross of Christ under the Trump administration, I swear to you," he added. "I will never allow the big media or left-wing pressure groups to silence you." Trump spoke for 75 minutes at the event, which invited "all eligible candidates from both parties" to speak. Trump's GOP challenger Nikki Haley declined the invitation and President Joe Biden didn't respond, according to NTD.com. Trump warned that Christians "cannot afford to sit on the sidelines in this fight." "The corrupt persecution by this regime will not stop with me," he said. "The chains are already tightening around all of us. "Ultimately, the radical left is coming after all of us because they know that our allegiance is not to them. Our allegiance is to our country. And our allegiance is to our creator. They don't want to hear that," he said. Trump's speech came two days before his keynote address at CPAC outside of Washington, D.C. Mark Swanson, a Newsmax writer and editor, has nearly three decades of experience covering news, culture and politics. © 2024 Newsmax. All rights reserved.
